decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal while utilizing cards like Madcap Experiment to cheat out Platinum Emperion, creating a powerful threat that can lock opponents out of the game. Blood Moon can disrupt opponent's mana bases, while cards like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique provide additional value and disruption. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish its win condition and protect it from opposing threats.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying powerful threats. With a mix of disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Leonin Arbiter, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's progression while aggressively attacking with cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Temple and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly cast its threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong board presence.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and repeatedly trigger its ability to deal massive damage to the opponent. This is achieved through cards like Farseek, Through the Breach, and Summoning Trap, as well as powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes cards like Anger of the Gods for board control and Huntmaster of the Fells for additional value. Overall, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with hasty, game-ending damage.

The deck is focused on efficiently dealing damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through the use of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By combining cards that deal direct damage to the opponent with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to protect against lifegain strategies, ensuring that the opponent's life total continues to decrease steadily.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal spells, and land disruption. By using cards like Path to Exile, Supreme Verdict, and Detention Sphere, the player can manage threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck utilizes Celestial Colonnade and Vendilion Clique for win conditions, while also generating card advantage with cards like Search for Azcanta and Cryptic Command. The deck aims to stabilize the board, control the game, and ultimately outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient threats.

The main concept of this Aggro - Hollow One deck is to quickly utilize discard spells like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to fill up the graveyard with creatures like Hollow One, Flameblade Adept, and Flamewake Phoenix. By utilizing delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, the deck is able to bring back creatures from the graveyard efficiently and put pressure on the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high number of threats early in the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless spells, such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated, to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to search for the UrzaTron lands efficiently, along with other utility cards like Oblivion Stone for board control and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon for additional removal and win conditions.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Oblivion Stone, Ghost Quarter, and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes big threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Walking Ballista to close out the game. Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide powerful planeswalker options for removal and card advantage. The goal is to control the game early and establish a dominant board presence with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of human creatures with powerful synergies. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuing to apply pressure. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and maintain a rapid tempo. With a strong mana base and versatile creatures, this deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through spells like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage. The deck includes a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Thought Scour and Search for Azcanta, the deck can effectively filter through its library to find key spells. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful threats like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Kolaghan's Command to close out the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find the Tron lands efficiently. The deck also includes powerful colorless threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Karn Liberated to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck can quickly ramp up to cast huge Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End, or board wipe with Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust.

The main focus of this Modern Aggro - Death and Taxes deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy while applying aggressive pressure. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter to tax your opponent's resources and slow down their game plan, you can create openings for your creatures like Restoration Angel and Flickerwisp to deal damage and close out the game. With efficient removal in Path to Exile and disruptive lands like Ghost Quarter and Tectonic Edge, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient burn spells and creatures with haste. The key strategy is to aggressively target the opponent's life total before they can stabilize, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel. By maintaining a fast pace and applying constant pressure, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can fully establish their board presence.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures and key spells like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Cathartic Reunion. By utilizing the Dredge mechanic, players can constantly return creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast back onto the battlefield. This creates a recurring army of creatures that can overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck also includes spells like Conflagrate and Lightning Axe to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently utilizing the graveyard as a resource.

The deck focuses on cycling creatures such as Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid to fill up the graveyard, while utilizing cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to cascade into Living End and bring back all the cycled creatures onto the battlefield. This combo allows for a powerful board presence that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of Fulminator Mage and Faerie Macabre to control the opponent's resources and maintain the tempo of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cycling creatures and cascade spells to cast Living End, allowing you to wipe your opponent's board while bringing back powerful creatures from your graveyard. The deck also includes disruption cards like Fulminator Mage and Faerie Macabre to control the game state, along with powerful win conditions in the form of Archfiend of Ifnir and the cycling creatures themselves. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt your opponent's game plan while quickly assembling your own combo to win the game.
